Lebowski.Net.Multichannel.MultichannelConnection

Lebowski.Net.Multichannel.MultichannelConnection Class Reference

Allows multiple separate connection to be tunneled through the same `IConnection`, by creating multiple channels. This is useful when you want to use the same connection for the synchroniation strategy, chat, execution result sharing, etc. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 MultichannelConnection (IConnection connection)
 Initializes a new instance of the MultichannelConnection class. It takes a connection (which must not be used in any other context) and adds another layer on top of it, allowing multiple logically separate connections to be tunneled through it at the same time.
void Close ()
 <inheritdoc>
IConnection CreateChannel ()
 Creates a new channeled connection.

Detailed Description

Allows multiple separate connection to be tunneled through the same `IConnection`, by creating multiple channels. This is useful when you want to use the same connection for the synchroniation strategy, chat, execution result sharing, etc.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Lebowski.Net.Multichannel.MultichannelConnection.MultichannelConnection ( IConnection  connection  ) 

Initializes a new instance of the MultichannelConnection class. It takes a connection (which must not be used in any other context) and adds another layer on top of it, allowing multiple logically separate connections to be tunneled through it at the same time.

Parameters:
connection 

Member Function Documentation

IConnection Lebowski.Net.Multichannel.MultichannelConnection.CreateChannel (  ) 

Creates a new channeled connection.

As channels acquire their identifier automatically, CreateChannel() must be called in the same sequence at all sites, as to ensure that local channels correspond to the correct remote channels.

Returns:
The channeled connection.
